EASTON BUSINESS REFERENCES.

OFFICERS.

CHARLES H. GIBSON, Prosccuting Attorney.
J. FRANK TURNER, Clerk of Circuit Coutt.
TILGHMAN N. CHANCE, Registrar of Wills.
W. H. COUNCELL, Post-Master.

WILLIAM S. GRACE, Sheriff.

A. CHAPLAIN, Superintendent of Public Schools,

—— FOUNTAIN,

JAMES DIXON, C°','"f7

B. Y.DAVIS. Commissioners.

WILLIAM H. D. HARPER, Clerk of County
‘Commissioners.

JOHN C. BARTLETT, Judge of Orphans’ Court.

P. W. STEWART, Magistrate,

N, PINKNEY, Medical Director in U. S. Navy.

COMMODORE LOWNDES, U. S. Navy.

J. L. CALDWELL, Superintendent o(vhlryhnd
and Delaware Railroad, and Proprietor of Cald-
well's Addition.,

ATTORNEYS.

OSWALD TILGHMAN, Attorney-at-Law,
CHARLES H. GIBSON, “
JAMES P. DAWSON, -,

‘W.E. STEWART, «
CHARLES BE. sahuaur. 5
1. C. W. POWELL, -

J. F. BATEMAN, (of Thomas & Bateman).

SAMUEL HAMBLETON, “

WILLIAM COLLINS, Junior, Attorney-at-Law.
Claims y Collected. Residence at Trappe.

JOSEPH B. SETH, Atomey-at-Law, 28 St.
Street, Baltimore.

ALBERT LOWE, “

BANES.

DR. I L. ADKINS, President,

GHN'L. R. THOMAS, Cashier.

JOSEPH GRAHAM, Teller.

HENRY HOLLYDAY, Genenl Book-keeper.
SAMUEL HAMBLETON,

B. L. F. HARDCASTLE,

JAMES DIXON,

R. B. DIXON, Directors.
?‘B K.BDAWBOI',

. H. HARRISON, ® Capital $200,000.
I L. ADKINS. Surplus $100,000.

BOOTS AND SHOES.

JESSE HUGHES, Manufacturer of and Dealer in
Boots and Shoes. Work of all kinds made to order
and guaranteed to please.

M. M. EIGGINS, Dealer in Boots, Shoes, and Hats,
Cor. of Washington and Dover Streets.

HEWETT LANGSDALE, Dealer in Boots, Shoes
and Groceries.

CARPENTERS AND CABINET MAKERS.

JOHN MASON, Underteker and Manufacturer and
Dealer in Fumiture of all kinds.

‘WILLIAMD. ROBERTS & SONS, Architects,
Carpenters and Builder. Shop and Office near R. R.

venue.,

SAMUEL PATCHETT, Undertaker and Cabinet

‘maker, Dealer in Fumiture, Picture Frames, Cof-
&c. &., Dover Street.
M. . FLOWERS, Carpenter, Contractor and Buil-

DRUGGISTS.

DAWSON & BRO., Dealers in Drugs, Medicines,
Chemicals, Fine Toilet Soaps, Fancy Hair and
Tooth Brushes, Perfumery and Fancy Articles,
‘Trusses and Braces, Grass and Garden Seeds, Pure
Wines and Liquors, Stationery, Glass, Putty, Paints,
Oils, Vamishes and Dye Stuffs, Physicians’ pre-
seriptions accurately compounded.

R. J. TRIPPE, Druggist and Apothecary, Dealer in
Drugs, Chemicals, Dyes, Painis, Oils, Glass, Fancy
and Toilet Articles, Perfumery, Soaps, Brushes, &c.

DRY GOODS AND GROCERIES.

THOMPSON & KERSEY, (Walter H. Thomp-
son, John F. Kersey.) Dealers in Foreign and Do-
mestic Dry Goods, Oil Cloths, Mattings,
&c., Opposite the Market House, Ladies and Gen-
tlemen’s Dress Goods a specialty.

J. 3. JUMP & CO, Grand Emporium for Ladies
and Gents' Dress Goods, Mattings, &.
)lmmdkgyt'kudymndg ing. Also Notions
Groceries, &c. Largest Stock, and Lowest prices on
the Peninsula.

J. W.CHEEZUM & CO., Dealers in Forcign and
Domestic Dry Goods, Groceries, Queensware, Car-
pets, Mattings, Oil Cloths, &c. Established 1838,

COVINGTON & BATEMAN, (J. H. Covington,
H. A. Bateman), Dealers in Staple and_ Fancy Dry
Goods, Notions, Groceries, &.

‘WILLIAM GRACE, Desler in Dry Goods, Groce-
ries, Notions and General Merchandise.

3. H. T. HUBBARD, Dealer in ' Groceries, Feed,
Produce, Fish, &c. Dover Street,

‘WALKER BRO. & CO,, Dealers in Dry Goods,
Notions, Groceries, Boots, Shoes, Provisions, &c.

* Dover Street.

T, T. MARTIN & CO., Wholesale and Retail Deal-

ers in General Merchandise.





EDITORS AND PUBLISHERS.

W. H. COUNCELL, Publisher of “Easton Ga-
zette,” o family paper of large and increasing cir-
culation.

THOMAS K. ROBSON, Editor of “ Easton Star.”
Polities—Democratic, Circulation large, Subscription
$2,00 & year.

LUMBER AND COAL.

ROBERT BJDIXON, Wholesale and Retail Deal-
er in all kinds of Lumber, Building Materials,
Lime, Laths, Hair, Anthracite and Cumber-
land Coals, and Fertilizers. Office on Dover Street,
Wharf and Yard at Easton Point.

JOHN A. ARRINGDALE, Dealer in Lumber and
Coal, Cor, Washington and Cabinet Streets.

LIVERY STABLES.

F. G. WRIGHT, Proprictor of Livery, Sale, and Feed
Stable. Office near Brick Hotel,

JESSE E. SHANNAHAN, Jr., Proprietor of
Livery and Exchange Stables. Horses fed by the
Meal, Day, or Month. Horses and Carriages for
Hire. Travellers sent to any part of the County or
Shore. Free Omnibus for the Brick Hotel to and
from the Cars and Steamboats.

- MILLINERY.

MRS, IE. V. HIGGING, Dealer in Fashionable
Millinery, Dress Trimmings, Embroideries, Notions,
&c. Adjoining M. E. Church,

MRS, J. H. T. HUBBARD, Dealer in ery
and Fancy Goods, Dress Trimmings, Embroideries,
& Dover Street.

PHYSICIANS AND DENTIST.

JAMES H. ANDERSON, Physician and Surgeon.

ISAAC A. BARBER, Homeopathist. Office Hours,
7,009 A. M. 1to3,and 6t0 8 P. M.

J. B/M. CHAMBERLAINE, Physician and Sur-



geon.
J. C. HARDIN, Dentist.

PAINTERS.

R. H. T. COUNCELL, House Painter and Paper
Hanger, Shop on R. R. Avenue.

E. H. FURNESS, House Painter and Paper Hanger,
Work done in town and country, by day or con-

tract.
ROBERT T. LARRIMORE, Painter.

TAILORS AND MERCHANT TAILORS.

SHANNAHAN & STRAUGHN, (J. A, Shan-
naban, J. Straughn), Merchant Tailors and Dealers
in Genis’ Furnishing Goods, Hats, Caps, and Um-
brellas.

JAMES H. LINTHICUM, Tailor and Dealer in
Hats and Caps.

I. N. BLETON, Fashionable Tailor, Next door to

Bank.
STEAM SAW MILLS.

JAMES M. WARNEK, Farmer and Proprietor of
Steam Saw Mill, located near School No. 2.

DUNCAN & BRO,, Proprietors of Steam Saw Mill,
one mile East of Easton on New Road, and Dealers
in Lumber. Sawing done to order,

ISAAC HYNER, Farmer and Proprietor of Steam
Saw Mill, 3 miles North East of Easton on Miles
River Creck.

W. W. TUNIS & BRO,, Proprictors of Oakland
Steam Saw Mills, Manufacturers and Dealers in
Yellow Pine Building Lumber, White Oak Ship

lank cut with Gang Saws, ~Also prime heart
king. Allflengths and sizes cut to order at short
ice. Cart and Wagon Felloes on hand and cut

order,
MISCELLANEOQUS,

A. A PABCAULT, General Agent and Collector.

CAPT. W. H. SMITH, Civil and Mining Engineer.

G. W. MINNICK, Dealer in Books, Stationery, Pa-
pers, Periodicals, Fancy Articles, &c.

5. B. HOPKINS & SON, Dealers in Carringes,
‘Hamness, Lap-Robes, Whips, Horse Cove, &c.

JOHN C. GALE, Dealer in Horses and Mules.

C.R. LEONARD & BRO,, Proprietors of Farmers
and Merchants’ Packet Line, plying between Bal-
timore and Easton.

JOSEPH H. WHITE, Manufacturer of Brick and
Drain Tile. Yard and Factory near Easton Point.
P. O. address Easton,

TUTHILL & AVERY, Manufacturers and Dealers
in Hardware, Harness, Tinware, Stoves, Engines,
Farm Machinery, &c. Proprietors of the Easton
Fouwndsy,

HUGH MoGINN, Florist and Proprietor of
McGinn's Greeahouse, Deale in Flowers and Tlans
of all descripti vergreens, Vegetables, Bul
e



E. of Easton.

W. B. TOWNSEND, Butcher and Proprietor of

Meat Market,

B, HARDCASTLE, Proprietor of Sherwood
ing Mills, All kinds of Family Flour man-

ufactured and kept on hand for sale at all times.

Custom work done. Mills near Skipton.
